newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Capital return, dividend sparks Singleton.
newsitem.headline: Capital return, dividend sparks Singleton.

text.p: Shares in advertising firm Singleton Group Ltd shot higher on Thursday after the company announced a capital return of 23 cents in addition to its previously announced special dividend of A$1.70.
By 11.20 a.m. (0120 GMT), Singleton Group shares were 30 cents higher at A$6.40 in moderate turnover after touching a record high A$6.51 early in the day.

The two transactions would return to shareholders all proceeds of the sale of Singleton's 10 percent voting stake in The TEN Group Ltd, Australia's third ranked television network, for A$59.15 million which was announced in November.
The return of capital is subject to shareholder approval by the next annual general meeting and subsequent court approval.
By 10.45 a.m. (0145 GMT), Singleton shares were 35 cents higher at A$6.45.
